intro: Psychotria basicordata, commonly known as the "basicordate Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It often grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical forests. Psychotria basicordata is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
